0: Senate Majority Whip Dick Durbin said on Sunday that the U.S. should not escalate military action beyond airstrikes in Iraq. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "The bottom line is this: There is so much we can do to help the Iraqis help themselves," the Illinois Democrat told David Gregory on NBC's "Meet the Press." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "Because only Iraq can save Iraq," Durbin added. "When it comes to Kurds, they have been the grownups in this neighborhood." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Asked whether it was galling that the U.S. is targeting its own military assets controlled by the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant, Durbin said it's nothing new. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "How many times has this happened in history?" Durbin said. "This is not new. It reflects the reality of war today, and it reflects the limitations when it comes to our fight against terrorism." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR If the U.S air campaign does not work, Durbin said, the U.S. should protect American interests on the ground and in the region. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "I can tell you this: Escalating it is not in the cards," he said.
